The product I am trying to build is now giving me the chills. It is getting interesting, it began as a basic recommedation system for books based on your past reads, but now I feel like I finally have a product wrapped around this. The idea is to have the main page house the recommendor then the second page the books you’ve read, a page with reviews about them in form of blog posts which can be shared just like you can share your spotify playlists using urls. Finally a third page where you can upload your own epubs and mobi to read, the app will track your progress, keep updating your reading status on your public profile, which houses (already mentioned) reviews. Share your reading status and past reads with your friends. Recommendor gives you options to add past reads, your current mood for your next read and any biases you would like for the choice for example similar to reads suggestions by some great personalities like bill gates or elon musk.

Read through some notes of Vinija’s notes also this google’s course on recommendation systems. Finally settled on developing a system that recommends by using both content based and collaborative filtering, more of Cb. Will be going through and implementing this research paper :
paper published by
Yiu-Kai Ng Computer Science Department, Brigham Young University.
Cheers.

I read through most of the important concepts of rust. And boi rustaceans are just so much spent on solving the memmory safety issue that c/c++ had. The pointers are smart pointers with owners, In threads prefer communication over channels and if required to use shared memory use “move” to pass the ownership to the thread! If required access by multiple threads use a smart pointer that has one to many owner relation(Arc,Rc). The language is’nt completely object oriented you don’t have classes instead you use structs and impl as classes make structs obsolete and vice versa :).

The libraries are bare bones; I saw for the first time a http server library exposing that it is creating a Socket and then adding a TCP listener to it like for real! Who does that, everyone is just hiding it into one single function lols.
Well I did’nt like writing software in C++ in the beginning but as time passed man I loved it. Wish it works out the same with rust 🦀.

title: Wrote multi threaded program in c++

description.text: Yupp, made multiple threads out of the main thread in the PDC software. Well the solution emerged out the very fundamental requirement of the PDC to connect with multiple PMUs at the same time. Since the program runs an infinite loop to accept data from the PMU continuously, you cannot process anything else. The major issue was that we could not run the sendCloseCommand function and stop the communication by our choice only option was to CTRL C. Thus implemented a 3 thread program that accepts data from three pmu and receives user commands on the main thread.
I was super excited while writing code for this part I didn't want to leave the lab even though I had a class at 2PM 😁
Started Final450, starting ones are easy as expected.

title: Wrote some react tests for TODO app

description.text: Got to learn how to write unit tests for react projects and realized how important it is to write them in bigger applications. I am working on a PDC software myself and as the days are passing by the application is becoming very large it is already more than 1000 lines of code.
To make it easier to debug when something breaks and to protect the company from pushing bugs into the live project it is very important to write tests.
Close to two months now. Well this post goes to explain where have I been and what am I planning to do with this blog space.

I was applying for Internships for the past two months, finally got one at BlueStacks. Applying requires you to constantly be prepping for interviews and taking OA and making assignments, explains why I stopped solving DSA problems.

The windows application I was building as a course project under IIT Ropar was a blast or should I say could’nt have been better. On the last day of the project, just a night before the final demonstration while testing the application on a different pc I observed that the application kept crashing after some 10-15 minutes while it won’t crash on the pc I used to work on. My head was spinning I had been testing the application for a while now but it worked for hours and hours on end. That night I was sold on the idea I’d be working on fixing the bug for the whole night. I tried everything “maybe the PMUs not working right ? change it”, “Maybe we have missed locking some common resource somewhere and the application is not thread safe and literally out of desperation I sprinkled mutex anywhere and everywhere I could think of” , “Maybe there is some error in the buffer to hex function and spent an hour trying several different iterations and AI models to fix up the issue all these possibilities because all that Visual studio could give as error was {an exception occured: Accessing memmory without permission} or something along similar lines.” and finally when I was about to give up I went out for a walk, One possiblity came to my mind - what the fucking if there are losses in the lan cable on the pc I was testing the application on!!. and bang that hit the bullseye. When I came back to the lab one of my good friend, team member came in as well and boi that we solved the bug in minutes. We basically had missed adding error handling for cases when the received data buffer was null and the software was trying to parse empty buffer/data arrays. I then ran the application the whole night on my PC over wifi! and it worked like a charm.
I learnt a lot from this project and made a good friend.

About this blogs page, well I have a 6 month internship so I am free from college for the next semester. I have some spare time after my internship work to allocate to problem solving and developing personal projects and this page serves the exact purpose “to document my daily learnings : ) “ So daily updates are on their wayyy!
Cheers,
Arpit

Sockets are like pointers but for traversing networks. When you start a socket you are returned an integer that you can use to start communication between a server and client.
There are two types of sockets
Socket stream - meant for reliable connections and data integrity. Protocols used are TCP/IP (Transmission control protocol)
Datagram socket - meant for speedy and unreliable connections, used in cases where some data loss is acceptable. Protocol used is UDP(user datagram protocol).

P2390; medium; 12:42, Following are some notes : It gave TLE in the first try.

The reason why using ans.push_back(st.top()) and reversing the string before returning it works fine, while using ans = st.top() + ans results in TLE, is because the + operator for strings is an expensive operation.

When you use ans = st.top() + ans, for every iteration of the while loop, you are creating a new string by concatenating the current character with the existing string. This new string is then assigned to the ans variable. As the size of the string increases, this operation becomes increasingly expensive, resulting in a TLE for larger inputs.

title: Finally there’s motion in the project

description.text: After commiting plenty of rookie mistakes we finally managed to establish a tcp connection with the phase measurement unit and received its config files.

In the beginning we were thinking that the PMU is a client and it is sending out requests to connect to server to send data, I know it sounds stupid now but we were not given any port that should have suggested us the alternate. Till yesterday we were thinking okay now that it is a server, after connecting to it why the hell is it not sending any data. Finally today while going through the documentation of IEEE C37.118 protocol I came to understand the basic flaw in our approach.

For any communication to start be whatever the protocol there should be a command frame sent by the client to initiate the conversation. I’ve read it in the course on IOT but boy am I not stupid enough to ignore it while implementing and waste time😭. Finally sent a demo command frame according to the docs and voilla we had the gibberish of a config response. Have to decode that piece tomorrow and then we’ll start receiving the phase data.

In January, I began drafting this article, and now, in July 2023, I realize I've been delaying its completion for quite some time. However, it's important to clarify that my procrastination wasn't centered around the article itself. Instead, it was due to the limited time I had available to address minor bugs in the Preact.js framework.

Speaking about the website, it operates on the Javascript library that I have developed. It functions as a single-page application with frontend hash routing, altering the URL with different hashes corresponding to various pages. When I deploy the website on a free-tier Platform as a Service (PaaS), it restricts direct access to other routes, making only the default route accessible through URL search and as I don’t have root access to these servers I had to opt for hash routing.

Not having an easy access to reliable servers for free meant no database and dynamic content on the website, to solve this I had to come up with some innovative solution to have a database that was convenient to update and tagged along with an API. I used google sheets for the projects and books I’ve read page. The data I maintain on the sheet is then hardcoded into the website repository using a Node.js-based automation script i wrote called gitcron. The script commits the changes in sheet on my behalf everytime I start my laptop.
Google sheets wasn’t a good choice for a CMS for blogposts and learning in public updates, So I chose Notion for this and hooked it up with the same script to update the website content.
Flow of the Website
You visit any domain pointing to this website; currently, it's https://arpitverma.vercel.app
The remote server responds with an index.html and some JavaScript files that get stored in your browser's session storage.
Now according to the route you are on in the website corresponding content is fetched from the stored javascript files.
These javascript files place the stored html into the virtual-dom element in the index.html
The logic and dynamic aspects of the page are implemented separately. As JavaScript stored in session storage cannot perform logic functions, it's used solely to call upon variables.
For the logic part, when a page is called, a corresponding logic script is injected in the index.html.
